title: Ghostly Ballroom Adventure #28
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Grand Ballroom
rooms.description: A magnificent ballroom frozen in time. Crystal chandeliers cast flickering light across the polished marble floor. Translucent figures in elegant gowns and tailcoats waltz endlessly to music only they can hear. The air is cold, and the scent of roses mingles with smoke. Portraits line the walls, and ornate furniture sits along the edges.

items.name: grand piano
items.description: A beautiful black piano covered in a layer of dust. Sheet music rests on the stand.

items.name: tarnished brass key
items.description: An old brass key with an ornate rose design on the handle

items.name: velvet settee
items.description: A luxurious red velvet couch with carved wooden legs

items.name: glass display cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with three shelves behind locked glass doors

items.name: gilded invitation
items.description: An elegant invitation card with gold lettering
items.text: You are cordially invited to the Grand Masquerade Ball at The Silver Rose Ballroom on December 31st, 1889. Join us for an evening of elegance and enchantment. - Lord and Lady Ashworth

items.name: yellowed newspaper article
items.description: A brittle newspaper clipping from 1890
items.text: TRAGEDY AT THE SILVER ROSE: Fire Claims Dozens at New Year's Ball. The blaze began in the east wing during the final waltz. Among the victims was the celebrated Lady Victoria Ashworth, who was the last to dance before the flames erupted.

items.name: portrait of Lady Victoria
items.description: A large oil painting of a beautiful woman in a white ball gown holding a silver rose
items.text: Lady Victoria Ashworth (1865-1889). Beloved daughter and gracious hostess. 'She who dances last shall be remembered first.'

items.name: portrait of Lord Ashworth
items.description: A stern-looking gentleman in formal attire
items.text: Lord Edmund Ashworth (1840-1889). Master of The Silver Rose Ballroom. A devoted father and patron of the arts.

items.name: ornate writing desk
items.description: A mahogany desk with intricate carvings and multiple drawers

items.name: Lady Victoria's diary
items.description: A leather-bound diary with a silver rose embossed on the cover
items.text: December 30th, 1889: Tomorrow is the grand ball! Father has spared no expense. The Silver Rose Ballroom will shine like never before. I've hidden my precious locket in the desk - the combination is the year of our grand celebration. I do hope the evening will be magical!

items.name: silver rose locket
items.description: A delicate locket shaped like a rose, warm to the touch despite the cold air

items.name: spiral staircase
items.description: A grand staircase leading up to the musicians' gallery

rooms.name: Musicians' Gallery
rooms.description: A balcony overlooking the ballroom where the orchestra once played. Music stands and instruments remain in place, covered in cobwebs. The ghostly music seems to emanate from here. Large windows show the moonlit gardens beyond, and a door leads to the terrace. Scorch marks on the walls hint at the fire's path.

items.name: conductor's music stand
items.description: An ornate stand with sheet music still attached
items.text: Final piece of the evening: 'The Last Waltz' - dedicated to Lady Victoria, who requested this be played as the clock strikes midnight.

items.name: violin case
items.description: A weathered case containing a violin and some papers

items.name: musician's note
items.description: A hastily written note on scorched paper
items.text: The fire started in the east wing just as Lady Victoria finished her dance. They say her spirit cannot rest until someone remembers her name and honors her as the last dancer. Only then will the curse be lifted and the doors to freedom open.

items.name: memorial plaque
items.description: A brass plaque mounted on the wall
items.text: In Memory of Those Lost in the Fire of 1889 at The Silver Rose Ballroom. May they find peace in the dance eternal.

items.name: cushioned window seat
items.description: A built-in seat beneath the large windows

items.name: servant's letter
items.description: A letter written in simple handwriting
items.text: To whoever finds this: The tragedy began in the east wing when a candelabra fell. Lady Victoria was the last dancer that night. The ballroom was called The Silver Rose, named after Lady Victoria's favorite flower. Remember these things, for they are the key to freeing the trapped souls.

items.name: terrace door
items.description: A set of French doors leading to the moonlit terrace. A brass panel beside the door displays three questions etched in elegant script.

password_questions.question: What was the name of this ballroom?
password_questions.hint: Check the invitation and the memorial plaque

password_questions.question: Where did the tragedy begin?
password_questions.hint: The newspaper clipping and musician's note mention this

password_questions.question: Who was the last dancer?
password_questions.hint: Multiple sources mention who danced last that fateful night

rooms.name: Moonlit Terrace
rooms.description: You step onto a beautiful stone terrace bathed in silvery moonlight. The ghostly music fades behind you, replaced by peaceful silence. Rose bushes bloom impossibly in the night, their silver petals glowing softly. A spectral figure appears before you - Lady Victoria herself, smiling with gratitude. She places a ghostly hand over her heart, bows gracefully, and dissolves into silver light. The curse is broken. A path through the gardens leads to freedom.

items.name: silver rose bushes
items.description: Magnificent roses that glow with an ethereal silver light, blooming in eternal beauty

items.name: marble bench
items.description: A pristine white bench overlooking the gardens, peaceful and inviting

items.name: garden path
items.description: A moonlit path leading through the roses to the world beyond

rooms.win_message: You have freed the spirits of The Silver Rose Ballroom! By remembering Lady Victoria and honoring her as the last dancer, you've broken the curse that bound the souls to their eternal waltz. The ghostly figures fade away peacefully, finally able to rest. You walk down the garden path into the moonlight, leaving the haunted ballroom behind forever. You win!
